DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function BRIEF Parent Form Questionnaire Self Monitor Scale T-Score BRIEF T Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the Self Monitor Organize Scale in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Parent Form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function BRIEF Parent Form Questionnaire Self Monitor Scale T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher._A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months._A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version that assesses aspects of social or interpersonal awareness. It captures the degree to which an adult perceives himself as aware of the effect that his behavior has on others._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
Concepts.definition: A standardized rating scale designed to assess the executive function behaviors in the school and home environments for children and adolescents as observed by a parent or teacher.

Property.preferredName: BRIEF Parent Form Questionnaire Self Monitor Scale T-Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months.:A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version that assesses aspects of social or interpersonal awareness. It captures the degree to which an adult perceives himself as aware of the effect that his behavior has on others.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function. The parent form is completed by one or both parents who must have recent and extensive contact with the child over the past 6 months.

A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function (BRIEF) that assesses aspects of social or interpersonal awareness. It captures the degree to which a person is aware of the effect that their behavior has on others and how it compares with standards or expectations for behavior.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean for the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: BRIEF-SR: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Self-Report Version. Steven C. Guy, PhD, Peter K. Isquith, PhD, Gerard A. Gioia, PhD, Psychological Assessment Resources, 2004
